storyInfo: In the early days of Karlan Trade, many elders were conservative and disapproved of Enciodes's methods. They attempted to sway Weiss to their side, unaware that this was precisely what Weiss had been waiting for all along...

attributes.content: Sunlight dances off the snow-capped mountains, rendering them immaculately radiant.
The howling wind carries the tolling of bells and the echoes of chanting voices, weaving through the peaks and narrating countless ancient tales.
Here, time seems to have stopped, as if everything has remained unchanged since the dawn of existence.
Hm?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Mmâ€”
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Judging from the depth of the footprints, the snow here is deeper than expected.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: No doubt from the previous localized snowfall. Given the steep slopes, if the snow keeps accumulating...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I believe the experts that Sir Enciodes hired said there could be heavy snowfall in the next few days.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: If that happens...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What is it, sir?
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Take a team and measure the depth of the snow, then get an expert to look at the slope gradient...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: And assess the risk of avalanche.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Then... I'll report to Sir Enciodes once this message has been passed on.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Weiss cannot help but frown at the scene before him.
Soldiers wearing the finest armor and wielding the best weapons have lost all will to fight.
Most lie moaning on the ground. Only a few still have the strength to glare at the tall, blonde woman who put them in this miserable state.
Weiss raises an eyebrow slightly at the sight of the old man beside the woman.
I presume you are not willing to grace us with your presence?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I'm just here to whip these weaklings into shape.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: There is no need for banquets.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I simply wish to express my appreciation for your training of Clan Silverash's warriors.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I'm not training them for Clan Silverash.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: And they won't be serving you.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Youâ€”
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Madam Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes has a message for you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: He has a meeting, and your presence is required.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Where is he?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Waiting for you at home.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: That's enough for today. Dismissed.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: ...*sigh*.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I've heard that she was a stubborn one. Today I got to see for myself.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You should not have come, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Have to hear it with my own ears to give up.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Just as well. I wanted to talk to you too, Weiss. A moment?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: ...Certainly.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What is it, Mr. Edwin?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'll cut straight to the chase. What do you think about Degenbrecher, Weiss?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: She's very strong. Sir Enciodes is much safer with her around.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You're a smart kid, Weiss. You know that isn't what I'm asking.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You want to know what I think of her presence.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: She has taken your place ever since Sir Enciodes brought her back. Do you truly not think anything of it?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: What I think is not important. What's important is that Sir Enciodes's work is progressing.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You sound like you don't like her.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I've heard her reputation, a three-time champion somewhere. And it's every bit well deserved, from what I saw today.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: But to spend so much money on one person, and putting her in such an important position...
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: If I may be blunt... Enciodes was shortsighted with this decision.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Pray be careful about your words, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Ever his steadfast defender.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I watched him grow up. He has to call me mister, same as you.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Do you think the others don't think the same way? They're just too afraid to speak their mind.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I'm sure it has occurred to you that Sir Enciodes did this in order to gain a foothold in Victorian high society.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Then why not leave her in Victoria?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Did he forget he already has a bodyguard in Kjerag?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: And what would this bodyguard think when he saw her?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: As I've said, what I think is not important.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Perhaps that's your outlook. You're a humble boy, after all.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: But what of the others?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: How much ground did the Paleroches and Browntails take from us in the years that he was abroad?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: How many went over to their sides?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Who fought tooth and nail to earn what Silverash has now?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Master Chester, Matterhorn, you, and old-timers like us.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Even if you don't think that way, how many would be envious? Unhappy?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: This isn't about Degenbrecher. I've seen my share of proud and capable youngsters.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: One or two of her won't do any harm.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: But those young people he brought back from Victoria will strip our flesh from our bones.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes doesn't play favorites.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Of course, he hasn't neglected us.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: But is that enough? Why are those fledglings considered our equals and even given better treatment?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Why should we step aside for them, after all that we've given for the clan?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Perhaps Sir Enciodes sees their value.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What value? Like my second son, who believes the future of Kjerag is in his hands just because he learned a few tricks?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Does Sir Enciodes really believe these arrogant fools can contribute to Kjerag's future?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Why are you so certain that I'm on your side, Mr. Edwin?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I watched you and Matterhorn give everything for the clan in the years that Sir Enciodes was away.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Never mind my old friends. I would say this for you two kids.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: What does it matter if you go and tell him?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I would say the same to his face, if he was standing in front of me today.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: But young people never listen.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You want to make an example of Madam Degenbrecher?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes, and the young people around him, need to realize that no foreigner can be the master of Kjerag.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: The easiest way to deal with a flock of unruly fowlbeasts is to make an example of the one that flies the highest.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: One moment.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: We finished the survey, sir.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: What did the expert say?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Sir, I...
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes trusts him. You can speak frankly.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Yes, sir. The expert says that your assessment is correct, and that the slopes over there are dangerous.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Any further snowfall could potentially cause an avalanche.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: ...I wish I was wrong.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: We were fortunate to find out now. It would have been too late, if not for your experience.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: We should report it to Sir Enciodes, shouldn't we?
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: ...I'll do it. Continue to keep an eye on things.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: What's on your mind, Weiss?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I understand where you're coming from, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Your concern for the future of Clan Silverash is most touching.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I knew you would understand.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I have an idea.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You heard the report. An avalanche is likely to occur in the near future.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I will ask Sir Enciodes to have Madam Degenbrecher organize a training near where the avalanche is expected to occur.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: When it does, we will request assistance.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Who knows what will happen in the chaos?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: ...A fine plan.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I would have thought it premeditated, had I not heard you talking to your men.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Wait, no, I understand. You've been thinking about this for a while, haven't you?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Yes. The others don't know you, but I do. You're a proud boy, deep down.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You won't just let someone take your place.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Yes, I've been waiting for someone loyal to Silverash like yourself.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The old man did not notice the emphasis that Weiss placed on 'Silverash'.
Sir, as I was delivering the message, I discovered that an avalanche is likely to occur around Moonfang Peak.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: How sure are you?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Based on my recent meteorological and geographical studies, 90% sure.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Expert analysis has confirmed the observation.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: This is an opportunity.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Do as you see fit.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I said you didn't need to call me 'sir'.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Old habits die hard.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I may need to borrow Madam Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Not a problem.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: You'll have to convince her yourself, though.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: Ha. I'll try.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Oh, I ran into Mr. Edwin today.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Oh? I've heard he's been active. What did he say?
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: He seems to be in good spirits, and sends you his regards.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Enciodes

attributes.content: What is it, Weiss? Coming out here was quite the trip for my old bones.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: There is something I wish to discuss.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What is it? Have you made arrangements regarding Degenbrecher?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Of course. No need to worry.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Say, why are there so few people in the village?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Simple.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: My men went door to door to persuade the villagers to evacuate.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The stubborn conservatives are the only ones left.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Conservatives? Evacuate?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: It would have taken more effort if you were better-informed.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Makes my preparations seem pointless when you just show up like this.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You... you set me up?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Not quite.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Didn't you hear there was going to be an avalanche?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: This is the place it's expected to happen.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What did you just say?!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Are you out of your mind, Weiss?!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I expected you to tell Enciodes, but I didn't expect this!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I'm not sure what you mean.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You lured me here and won't let me leave... what do you think I mean?!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You thought I brought you to 'Kjeragandr's turnover' to eliminate you?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What else?! You cold-hearted, ungrateful bastard!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Yes, that's what the people of Kjerag would have thought in the past.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Butâ€”
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'll be frank with you, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: There are easier ways to kill you, if that's what I intended.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Butâ€”
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Progress report.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: All the buildings near the mountain have been demolished. We have plenty of space to set up a line of defense.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: As expected, however, we are meeting resistance from some of the residents who refuse to leave.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: The evacuation?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Most of the residents are listening to us and are evacuating. The more stubborn ones refuse to believe us, though.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Where are you going, sir?
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Requesting Madam Degenbrecher's assistance.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The old noble frantically tries to escape the room, no longer paying attention to what Weiss is saying.
However, Weiss seizes him by the shoulders and pushes his bloated frame toward the warrior.
Take good care of Mr. Edwin while I'm gone.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Yes, sir.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Don't worry, Mr. Edwin. You'll live, at least for today.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I need your help with something, Madam Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You're out of breath. Something serious?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: We believe an avalanche is about to occur near Moonfang Peak, and we need your help.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Do you really need my help?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Of courseâ€”
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: My team has set up defenses, but I need you and your team to help protect the residents who insist on staying.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: If I recall correctly, Enciodes has given you and your team quite the power.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: You seem too smart to leave such a large gap that would need me to cover.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: We're short-handed, after all.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'm curious. Why go to such lengths for me?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: When I was little, I would sometimes run off into the mountains after a fight with Matterhorn.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But I always went back home for dinner, my tail between my legs, when I got hungry,
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: That was when I learnedâ€”
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: No matter what we do out there during the day, we always return to the same place and eat at the same table at night.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: And it would be too awkward to be on bad terms with someone else at that table.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You heard the man.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Get ready to move.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Ma'am, yes, ma'am!
attributes.name: Warriors

attributes.content: Like master, like servant. You're just like Enciodes.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I'll take that as a compliment.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You just reminded me, though.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Speaking of avalanche...
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Sayâ€”
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Isn't 'madam' a little too distant when we're eating at the same table?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Change it.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Umm...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Well.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'll leave it to you...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Degenbrecher does not turn around, but neither does she complain.
Ha.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Time to deal with the other problem.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'm back.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What did Madam Degenbrecher say?
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: She will help.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Good to hear. The people's opinion of her will change, if they see her help them out.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: It's not that she wouldn't. She just needed a chance.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: What of Mr. Edwin?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Much calmer. He asked for a cup of tea.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: That's the Mr. Edwin I know.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I told you, I would say the same to Sir Enciodes's face.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I was a fool to be deceived by your facade and to believe you could be won over. You've got meâ€”now do as you will.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: I went through all this trouble because I know what kind of person you are.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: If you'd been anything else, you would have died that day in the mountains.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Hmph. Now I'm curious why you planned all this.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You were setting the stage for Degenbrecher from the beginning?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: She'll get there eventually, I'm just helping speed things up.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Why go to such lengths for her?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: You thought I would dislike Degenbrecher, because you thought I was like you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: A decade ago, perhaps I'd agree. But I let those feelings go a long time ago.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: There are many ways that I can serve Sir Enciodes. Being his bodyguard is not the only way.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: And I'm sure he would be disappointed in me if I agreed with you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Not loathing Degenbrecher is one thing. Why would you help her? Would she even appreciate it?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: At first, I only trusted the judgment of Sir Enciodes, who brought her here. And I admit, she was not easy to get along with.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But when you understand that her aloofness is not hostility, only detachment, even confusion...
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Then you realize there is no reason to fear her.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You've never seen her standing in the woods, patiently listening to a herder's small talk despite her apparent indifference.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: If you had, you would want more people to understand and accept her, as I do.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: It will be a good thing for Kjerag, for herself, and for Sir Enciodes, if she is accepted by Kjerag.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: As for whether she appreciates my help... that doesn't matter.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Does Enciodes know what you're doing?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes has to take radical measures to achieve his vision.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Opposition to his methods is expected, but he only has so much time and energy, and he cannot deal with all of it on his own.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I'm simply helping to share the burden where I can.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Whether he knows it or not is equally unimportant.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Follow me, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You will soon learn that Sir Enciodes's vision has long been much more than just the Silverash Clan.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The old noble suddenly thinks that the avalanche does not matter anymore.
Because he sees a vast open expanse where houses once stood.
A dozen or so massive trucks, laden with heavy machinery, are parked across the field. The robotic arms of the machinery transform and interlockâ€”
Coming together to form a wall of steel.
What isâ€”
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: There is a bit of a story behind this.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: I've become quite familiar with the mountains and snow of Kjerag, after years of delivering Sir Enciodes's letters.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: When he returned to Kjerag, he authorized me to form an avalanche warning team.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: We were able to accurately predict this avalanche with the help of the experts who came back to Kjerag with him.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: We can't stop a big avalanche, but we can trigger it before it builds up beyond our capabilities.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: That way, we nip large-scale avalanches in the bud, and prevent them from happening.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: You're too humble, sir.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Initially, we thought the best we could do was issue avalanche warnings ahead of time; since we didn't have the people or resources to stop them.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: Your plan completely changed things.
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: I just came up with the idea. It's the experts who cracked the complicated math.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Preventing large avalanches?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Yes. You're looking at our line of defense.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: It will grow even stronger in the future.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: When that day comes, anyone can stand where you stand right now, and watch Kjeragandr's turnover.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But for now, you're the first to be in that best seat.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Watch as it begins.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: It begins with a small chunk of snow slipping and falling. As though it were a cue, a low, deep rumble reverberates through the valley.
In an instant, the trickle of snow transforms into a roaring torrent, uprooting trees and sweeping away boulders.
The avalanche hurtles down the mountainside with terrifying speed, as if the entire mountain is spilling forth. Everywhere it passes, it paints an awe-inspiring yet dreadfully horrifying picture.
It was once the stuff of nightmares for the people of Kjerag, one that they could not flee fast enough from.
This time, however, a group of brave men and women stands firm at the mountain's foot, looking up with confidence.
With the wall of steel that they have built, they vow to challenge this snowy authority that has gone uncontested since time immemorial.
The tidal wave of ice and snow crashes against the line of defense formed by the trucks.
Despite being thousands of times heavier than man, the massive trucks seem insignificant before the power of nature and are pushed back. Some are even toppled.
But the wisdom of man prevails.
Gradually, the force pushing against the line of steel diminishes.
The defense line buckles, but it does not break, slowly coming to a stop a dozen meters before Weiss and the old man.
The avalanche, triggered by human hands, has been stopped.
When the new railroad is finished, it will carry this line of defense to every corner of Kjerag, ready to respond at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Long has Kjeragandr's turnover been the terror of Kjerag. Many are the lives and homes it has taken.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But in the near future, the people of Kjerag will sit where you are now, watching our defense line stop avalanches, just as it did today.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Could you ever imagine something like this?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: No, you couldn't.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Neither could I.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But it's happening before our eyes.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The old man's scarf has flown away in the wind, his hair and beard are caked with snow. Otherwise, he is completely unharmed.
Weiss continues to grab his shoulder with an iron hand, not giving him the slightest chance to escape.
But if he paid attention, the old noble would notice with a side glance that Weiss's attention is not on him at all.
His eyes are fixed on the line of steel that he has organized. His tightened grip on the old noble's shoulders is simply out of sheer excitement.
Degenbrecher?!
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Shouldn't you be assisting with the evacuation?
attributes.name: Weiss
Weiss
attributes.content: Why are you coming down from the avalancheâ€”

attributes.name: Weiss
attributes.content: Wait, what's that on your backâ€”?!
attributes.joined: Why are you coming down from the avalancheâ€”Wait, what's that on your backâ€”?!

attributes.content: I heard there was a couple who weren't able to get out in time. I went to look for them.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: They're alive.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Get them to a doctor, now.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Yes, sir. And ma'am!
attributes.name: Agile Kjerag Warrior

attributes.content: I... Thank you so much, Degenbrecher.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: So that's an avalanche. Interesting.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I'll be going. Feel free to call me when there's another one.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Will do.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: She charged into that avalanche on her own?!
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Honestly, I didn't expect it either.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: But I hope you understand now.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: The foreigners are given better treatment because they have what Kjerag doesn't, what Kjerag can't even imagine.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Think about it, Mr. Edwin.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Would you, or those behind you rather get swept away by the tide?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Or would you rather ride it and watch as we conquer what once seemed insurmountable?
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Is it too late to get on board?
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: It's never too late.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Sir Enciodes welcomes everyone who is willing to build a new Kjerag together.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: A moment of silence, then the old man nods, if only reluctantly.
I suppose I've grown old.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: Not that old. Kjerag still needs you.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: ...I'll think about it. And I'll talk to them.
attributes.name: Old Noble

attributes.content: We're counting on it.
attributes.name: Weiss

attributes.content: Weiss smiles.
The old man has seen Weiss smile many times. He knows that, more often than not, it is simply a form of self-defense.
But this time, it is sincere.
Sunlight dances on his face, and his smile is radiant.
